TITLE: Tech's biggest event starts this week. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: CES, typically one of the year's biggest tech trade shows, is moving forward with plans to host an in-person component this week despite looming threats of the Omicron Covid-19 variant.

TITLE: India is investigating a fake website that offered Muslim women for sale
SUMMARY: The Indian government says it is investigating a website that purported to offer Muslim women for sale, the second time in less than a year that a fake online auction of this kind has sparked outrage in the country.

TITLE: Jury in Elizabeth Holmes trial will resume deliberations Monday
SUMMARY: The high-profile criminal trial of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes will officially stretch into a new calendar year Monday when the jury entrusted with determining her fate will continue deliberations after a short respite.

TITLE: Classic BlackBerry phones will stop working January 4
SUMMARY: You soon won't be able to use that old BlackBerry phone sitting at the bottom of your drawer somewhere.

TITLE: 2021: The year of billionaires going to space
Chinese tech stocks are climbing on the last day of the year. But 2021 has been a bloodbath
SUMMARY: Chinese tech stocks got a big boost in Hong Kong on the last day of the year, but it's far from enough to make up for what has been a historically tumultuous time for the sector.

TITLE: Sirisha Bandla, India-born woman and Virgin Galactic executive, flies into space with Richard Branson
SUMMARY: Indians on Twitter — from top politicians to business executives — are celebrating one of the women who flew to the edge of space along with Richard Branson.

TITLE: Tesla recalls 475,000 vehicles due to camera and front trunk issues
SUMMARY: Over 475,000 Tesla Inc (TSLA) cars have been recalled due to technical defects that may increase the risk of accidents. Two separate recalls are in place, one regarding the rear-view camera in the Tesla Model 3 and the other involves the frunk, or front trunk, latches in the Model S.

TITLE: China's Xi'an lockdown hits some of the world's largest chipmakers
SUMMARY: Two of the world's biggest chipmakers are warning that Covid-19 outbreaks and stringent lockdowns in a major Chinese industrial hub are hampering their operations.

TITLE: After hours offline, Fortnite access has been restored
SUMMARY: After hours offline, Fortnite servers were restored at 6:50pm EST Wednesday.

TITLE: TikTok sued by content moderator who claims she developed PTSD from reviewing disturbing content
SUMMARY: A content moderator for TikTok is suing the social media platform after she says she developed psychological trauma as a result of her job, which she alleges required her to review videos featuring graphic violence, conspiracy theories and other disturbing imagery.

TITLE: How John Madden became the biggest name in video games
SUMMARY: John Madden, the former Hall of Fame NFL coach, has died. But his name lives on in one of the world's most popular video games.

TITLE: Waymo will partner with China's Geely to develop electric robotaxis
SUMMARY: Waymo, the self-driving arm of Google's parent company Alphabet, and Chinese carmaker Geely have partnered to build electric, fully autonomous ride-hailing vehicles to be used across the united States.

TITLE: Elon Musk's SpaceX satellites catch heat in China over close calls with space station
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's rocky year in China is ending on another sour note.

TITLE: Riot Games agrees to $100 million settlement in gender discrimination lawsuit
SUMMARY: Tencent Holdings' Riot Games on Monday said it has agreed to pay $100 million to settle a 2018 gender-based discrimination class-action lawsuit with California state agencies and current and former women employees.

TITLE: Alphabet CEO Pichai can be questioned in privacy lawsuit, judge rules
SUMMARY: Plaintiffs who accused Alphabet Inc's Google of unlawfully tracking their internet use while on "Incognito" browsing mode can question Chief Executive Sundar Pichai for up to two hours, a California federal judge has ruled.

TITLE: Apple closes all New York stores to browsing as Omicron cases surge
SUMMARY: Apple has closed all of its New York store locations to browsing because of a surge in Covid-19 cases. The roughly one dozen locations in the city will be limited to picking up online orders and walk-in services such as Genius Bar support.

TITLE: China plans to tighten rules on overseas IPOs
SUMMARY: China is planning to tighten restrictions for Chinese companies that want to list overseas. And while Beijing won't ban them from trading abroad altogether, life might be getting a lot tougher for firms hoping to score more foreign investment.

TITLE: The biggest tech fails of 2021
SUMMARY: For many, 2021 was a mix of hopeful and challenging, as covid vaccines became more widely available but the pandemic dragged on for another year. And while technology continued to keep us entertained and connected during the pandemic, it also made our lives harder.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes Trial: Jury says it is deadlocked on three counts
SUMMARY: The jury tasked with determining the fate of Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos in her criminal trial, said that it is unable to come to a unanimous verdict on three of the eleven counts.

TITLE: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene says Facebook blocked her account for 24 hours
SUMMARY: Facebook has blocked Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene from posting on its platform for 24 hours, the Georgia Republican said Monday.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes trial: The jury has reached a verdict
SUMMARY: The jury in the criminal trial of Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of Theranos, has reached a verdict. Holmes was found guilty on four charges — three counts of wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. The jury returned no verdict on three counts of wire fraud.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes found guilty on four out of 11 federal charges
SUMMARY: The jury in the criminal trial of Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of Theranos, has reached a verdict. Holmes was found guilty on four charges — three counts of wire fraud and one count of conspiracy to commit wire fraud. The jury returned no verdict on three counts of wire fraud. She was found not guilty on three additional charges of wire fraud and one charge of conspiracy to commit wire fraud.

The jury in the criminal trial of Elizabeth Holmes, the former CEO and founder of Theranos, has reached a verdict after a lengthy trial that kicked off last fall at a federal courthouse in San Jose presided over by Judge Edward Davila.

TITLE: The key moments from Elizabeth Holmes' trial
SUMMARY: After nearly four months of court proceedings in one of the most high-profile tech trials in recent memory, Elizabeth Holmes has been found guilty on four out of 11 federal fraud and conspiracy charges.

TITLE: AT&T and Verizon agree to postpone 5G rollout near airports by 2 weeks
SUMMARY: AT&T and Verizon have agreed to postpone their planned rollouts of 5G infrastructure near airports by two weeks, averting — for now — feared widespread disruptions to air travel and shipping as well as a potential legal battle over the matter.

TITLE: The rise and fall of Elizabeth Holmes: A timeline
SUMMARY: More than three years after Elizabeth Holmes was first indicted and nearly four months after her trial kicked off, the founder and former CEO of failed blood testing startup Theranos was found guilty on four out of 11 federal fraud and conspiracy charges.

TITLE: Classic BlackBerry phones stop working today
SUMMARY: You can no longer use that old BlackBerry phone sitting at the bottom of your drawer somewhere.
